review_title: Good org to work for, pay leader
pros: MNBC is a non-profit with a good mission. Departments are relatively siloed so your experience will vary depending on where you work. I've concluded that they are a pay leader based on the salary I was making. Excellent work life balance.
cons: Bureaucracy, sometimes vision toward end goal can be blurred by complications

pros: It's at a very accessible location. Steps away from Gateway skytrain station.
cons:
The fish rots from the head. The leadership of this organization is toxic and ego-driven. It is surprising and disappointing, given that they are an Indigenous body. They treat workers horribly -- e.g. forcing workers to go into the office even as covid numbers were rising while the directors/managers got to work remotely when they felt like it. The leadership often failed to provide any support or directions to staff in their work -- I've heard countless times when colleagues expressed that they had no instructions, no responses, and no support from their directors. The leadership loved playing favourites -- the favoured employees could get away with all kinds of belligerent and toxic behaviours (e.g. yelling at staff in an open office) while the others would be fired for simply looking at a director in a "wrong" way. They hired and fired staff all the time. The staff turnover was alarming. 

I could go on. Suffice to say, this is a terrible workplace. I've worked at many organizations and this is by far the most disorganized and toxic place.
